text: Which of the following are true about the differences between VFX Graph and the Particle System? Select all answers that apply.

options.text: VFX Graph supports a higher particle count than the Particle System.
VFX Graph runs on the CPU, while the Particle system runs on the GPU.
The Particle System uses Unity’s underlying physics system, allowing particles to interact with other physics-based objects in the scene.
Even though the Particle System is a bit simpler to use, VFX Graph is capable of producing more complex simulations and allows for more customizable behaviors.

feedbackCorrect:
VFX Graph supports millions of particles, while the Particle System only supports thousands.

VFX Graph runs on the GPU, while the Particle System runs on the CPU.

The particles from a Particle System use Unity’s underlying physics system, allowing the particles to interact with other physics-based objects in the scene.

Even though the Particle System is a bit simpler to use, VFX Graph is capable of producing more complex simulations and allows for more customizable behaviors.
